variation.name: Units for pure numbers
variation.description: 304.10 An item with a pureItemType data type MUST have a unit element and the local part of the measure MUST be "pure" with a namespace prefix that resolves to a namespace of "http://www.xbrl.org/2003/instance".

variation.name: Units for pure numbers - counterexample - local name does not resolve
variation.description:
A measure element with a namespace prefix that resolves to the "http://www.xbrl.org/2003/instance" namespace MUST have a local part of either "pure" or "shares".
The value 'impure' is not a valid measure in the XBRL instance namespace.

variation.name: Units for pure numbers - counterexample - the namespace string is incorrect
variation.description: Unlike for monetaryItemType and sharesItemType, there is no constraint (in 4.8.2 or elsewhere) requiring an item with a pureItemType data type to have a particular kind of unit.

variation.name: Units for sharesItemType items MUST have A single measure element
variation.description: 304.13 For facts that are of the sharesItemType, units MUST have A single measure element. The local part of the measure MUST be "shares" and the namespace prefix that MUST resolve to http://www.xbrl.org/2003/instance

variation.name: Units for sharesItemType items derived by restriction
variation.description: 304.14 For facts that are DERIVED BY RESTRICTION from the sharesItemType, units MUST have A single measure element. The local part of the measure MUST be "shares" and the namespace prefix that MUST resolve to http://www.xbrl.org/2003/instance

variation.name: Units for sharesItemType items - counter example
variation.description: 304.15 For facts that are of shares item type, units MUST have A single measure element. The local part of the measure MUST be "shares" and the namespace prefix that MUST resolve to http://www.xbrl.org/2003/instance. In this case the unit has two measure elements, both of which are pure.

variation.name: Units must be in their simplest form
variation.description: 304.16 The units must not have numerator and denominator measures that cancel.

variation.name: Units equality. invalid case with measure element
variation.description: 304.21 it tries to essence-alias equality of two elements with different units : where one is pure-feet and the second is pure-pounds. so the alias essence check is invalid and it should throw an error in xbrl validation
